titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Manbites Dog Theater Records, 1987-2017 and undated RL.11437
titlestmt.author: Paul Sommerfeld, Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-19 18:56:03 UTC.

change.item: revised to reflect the processing of accession 2018-0073
revised to reflect the processing of accession 2019-0189

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Manbites Dog Theater was a professional non-profit theater company founded in Durham in October 1987. Manbites Dog staged a variety of theatrical productions, with a focus on premieres of new works by working closely with playwrights, directors, actors, and artists. The theater mounted over 130 productions, many of them regional or state premieres. The theater closed in 2018. Collection includes a variety of administrative documents from these productions, including marketing materials, reviews, contracts, and box-office records. Also includes administrative documents from more general theater operations.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Manbites Dog Theater was a professional non-profit theater company founded in Durham in October 1987. Manbites Dog staged a variety of theatrical productions, with a focus on premieres of new works by working closely with playwrights, directors, actors, and artists. The theater mounted over 130 productions, many of them regional or state premieres. In March 1997, Manbites Dog purchased a building near downtown Durham to serve as a permanent performance space for the company. The building opened to the public in fall 1998. Original production included Indecent Materials, Hotline, Walking Miracles, A Tune for Tommy, Plays Well With Others, Bucknaked: A Love Story, Caleb Calypso and the Midnight Marauders, and Now You See Me. The theater closed in 2018.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Manbites Dog Theater Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2017, 2018, and 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Manbites Dog Theater Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Addition 2018-0073 processed by Andie Adkins and Alice Poffinberger, October 2018
Addition 2019-0189 processed by Jasmine Alexander-Greene and Alice Poffinberger, February 2020
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2017-0044, 2017-0064, 2018-0073, 2019-0189.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes a variety of administrative documents from the company's productions. Theater Seasons consists of marketing materials, reviews, contracts, and box-office records from individual productions. Some productions include photographs, scripts, and DVD and VHS recordings. Arranged chronologically by season and chronologically by production within each season. Administrative Files comprises materials more broadly related to running the theater company, including receipts, contracts, fundraising materials, and financial records. Includes a few videocassettes. Arranged alphabetically by folder title.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Technical Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed. Contact the Research Services Department before coming to use this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of marketing materials, reviews, contracts, and box-office records related to individual productions. Marketing materials include programs, posters, flyers, postcards, and other handouts. Reviews are primarily newspaper clippings from local and regional papers such as the Raleigh News & Observer, the Durham Herald Sun, and The Independent Weekly. Contracts are between the company and a variety of performers, directors, playwrights, and artists. Box-office records are for individual performances, noting both attendance and revenue. Some productions also include correspondence, expense reports and other financial documents, scripts, photographs, and DVD or VHS recordings. Arranged chronologically by season and chronologically by production within each season.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RESTRICTED: Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Use of these materials may require production of listening or viewing copies. Please contact Research Services before coming to use this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative Files comprises materials more broadly related to Manbites Dog operations. Includes some correspondence, marketing materials for acting classes, newspaper clippings, receipts and other financial records, and some fundraising materials, including grant applications. Also contains materials related to the National Endowment for the Arts, such as application materials, correspondence, and status reports. Includes a few videocassettes. Arranged alphabetically by folder title.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RESTRICTED: Original audiovisual materials are closed to use. Use of these materials may require production of listening or viewing copies. Please contact Research Services before coming to use this collection.
